Articles.Content: haha I could do a showcase, it wont be hard at all. just simple IR work

> 
> It will not fit inside the orbiter cargo bay. It's meant to be launched atop an Atlas V 401. I don't know how realistic it would be to make foldable wings in order to put it inside the orbiter cargo bay, and I don't really see the point of going all out Xzibit and putting shuttles inside of shuttle because you like shuttles ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
> epic DAWG pic

Quote just because. xD

Still incoming work at CSS, but a progress showcase would be great. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> It will not fit inside the orbiter cargo bay. It's meant to be launched atop an Atlas V 401. I don't know how realistic it would be to make foldable wings in order to put it inside the orbiter cargo bay, and I don't really see the point of going all out Xzibit and putting shuttles inside of shuttle because you like shuttles ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
> http://i.imgur.com/0qoKkZw.jpg'>[http://i.imgur.com/0qoKkZw.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/0qoKkZw.jpg)

Artwhaleys mod came with an atlas rocket it's actually not bad. It's a good model and a great simple launcher.

Don't know, but if you are looking for a launcher, I have the Atlas V in Launchers Pack (see signature), it's currently not working in 1.0 but I am almost finished configuring it. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> 
> It will not fit inside the orbiter cargo bay. It's meant to be launched atop an Atlas V 401. I don't know how realistic it would be to make foldable wings in order to put it inside the orbiter cargo bay, and I don't really see the point of going all out Xzibit and putting shuttles inside of shuttle because you like shuttles ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
> [http://i.imgur.com/0qoKkZw.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/0qoKkZw.jpg)

It was for...ummm....scientific purposes that i thought i could put it in the cargobay
Make a scaled down version that fits in a cargo bay and I will be happy.
How's this coming along?
Have made controll surfaces for it like how it is in real life. Yes it comes with its launcher too
Awesome

> 
> Don't know, but if you are looking for a launcher, I have the Atlas V in Launchers Pack (see signature), it's currently not working in 1.0 but I am almost finished configuring it. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

I was using all your mods back in .90 ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) Waiting patiently for launchers pack to be updated to 1.0. I want to use your Antares replica to launch Cygnus to my new space station. I am still getting 60 fps, so can easily fit a couple more modules to it.

Btw Mike, I used "your" shuttle to bring all these modules up. Conclusion; it works great!

![3mSbFm9.png](http://i.imgur.com/3mSbFm9.png)

I know you weren't implying anything I am just saying in general once he is one with the Shuttle the ISS and Dreamchaser will be amazing.

Ofcourse i follow the pack!! I've been using it since dragon fixed it, but with the new cargo stuff and the Enterprise with the 747, it makes it even better!

[https://www.dropbox.com/s/6m1lboyrqkz8tti/Space%20Shuttle%20v1.7.zip?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/6m1lboyrqkz8tti/Space%20Shuttle%20v1.7.zip?dl=0)

Dreamchaser (rescaled) to go with the shuttle is in that mod I put together. Still WIP but working if anyone wants a play with it

ISS redevelopment is in progress from page 133 onwards here : [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/121748-Component-Space-Shuttle-CSS-ksp-1-0-2-unofficial-release-thread/page139](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/121748-Component-Space-Shuttle-CSS-ksp-1-0-2-unofficial-release-thread/page139)

section redone so far:

trusses 3 to 6.

new solar panels, separately attach. no error codes. 'docking' attachments between trusses.

![Md5UJvQ.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/Md5UJvQ.jpg)

Docking ports will now be attached to the relevant models to keep part count down and for simplicity. 

Except for the instances where docking modules need to be relocated on the iss
Hey, Mike, just downloaded your space shuttle. Will be testing it asap
